verses.verse: ((Is. 53:12; Heb. 2:14)) Having disarmed (Eph. 6:12) principalities and powers, He made a public spectacle of them, triumphing over them in it.
So let no one (Rom. 14:3) judge you in food or in drink, or regarding a festival or a new moon or sabbaths,
(Heb. 8:5; 10:1) which are a shadow of things to come, but the substance is of Christ.
Let no one cheat you of your reward, taking delight in false humility and worship of angels, intruding into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
and not holding fast to (Eph. 4:15) the Head, from whom all the body, nourished and knit together by joints and ligaments, (Eph. 1:23; 4:16) grows with the increase that is from God.
Therefore, if you (Rom. 6:2-5) died with Christ from the basic principles of the world, (Gal. 4:3, 9) why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to regulations—
(1 Tim. 4:3) “Do not touch, do not taste, do not handle,”
which all concern things which perish with the using— (Is. 29:13; Matt. 15:9; Titus 1:14) according to the commandments and doctrines of men?
(Rom. 13:14; 1 Tim. 4:8) These things indeed have an appearance of wisdom in self-imposed religion, false humility, and neglect of the body, but are of no value against the indulgence of the flesh.

Not Carnality but Christ If then you were (Rom. 6:5; Eph. 2:6; Col. 2:12) raised with Christ, seek those things which are above, (Ps. 68:18; 110:1; (Rom. 8:34); Eph. 1:20) where Christ is, sitting at the right hand of God.
Set your mind on things above, not on things on the ((Matt. 6:19-21)) earth.
((Rom. 6:2; 2 Cor. 5:14; Gal. 2:20); Col. 2:20) For you died, ((2 Cor. 5:7)) and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
((1 John 3:2)) When Christ who is (John 14:6) our life appears, then you also will appear with Him in (1 Cor. 15:43) glory.

((Rom. 8:13)) Therefore put to death ((Rom. 6:13)) your members which are on the earth: (Eph. 5:3) fornication, uncleanness, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, (Mark 7:21; 1 Cor. 6:9, 18; 2 Cor. 12:21; Gal. 5:19; Eph. 4:19; 5:3, 5) which is idolatry.
(Rom. 1:18; Eph. 5:6; Rev. 22:15) Because of these things the wrath of God is coming upon ((Eph. 2:2)) the sons of disobedience,
(1 Cor. 6:11; (Eph. 2:2); Titus 3:3) in which you yourselves once walked when you lived in them.
(Eph. 4:22; 1 Pet. 2:1) But now you yourselves are to put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy language out of your mouth.
Do not lie to one another, since you have put off the old man with his deeds,
and have put on the new man who (Rom. 12:2; 2 Cor. 4:16) is renewed in knowledge ((Rom. 8:29)) according to the image of Him who ((Eph. 2:10)) created him,
where there is neither (Rom. 10:12; (1 Cor. 12:13); Gal. 3:27, 28) Greek nor Jew, circumcised nor uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free, (Eph. 1:23) but Christ is all and in all.
Character of the New Man Therefore, ((1 Pet. 1:2)) as the elect of God, holy and beloved, (Luke 1:78; Phil. 2:1; 1 John 3:17) put on tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering;
((Mark 11:25)) bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; even as Christ forgave you, so you also must do.
(1 Pet. 4:8) But above all these things ((1 Cor. 13)) put on love, which is the (Eph. 4:3) bond of perfection.
And let ((John 14:27; Phil. 4:7)) the peace of God rule in your hearts, (1 Cor. 7:15) to which also you were called (Eph. 4:4) in one body; and ((1 Thess. 5:18)) be thankful.
Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another (Eph. 5:19) in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
